forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and showers and thunderstorms before 4pm. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. Southwest wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
In Boston this afternoon, a blanket of patchy fog cloaks the city, mingling with intermittent showers and the rumble of distant thunder. The sky wears a veil of heavy clouds, hinting at the weight of moisture suspended overhead, colors muted and dreary. As the temperature settles near sixty, a gentle but persistent south wind picks up speed, offering a crisp bite that hints of the chill to come. The air is thick with the promise of rain, a certainty that swells into a 100% chance of showers, foreshadowing muddy streets and a subdued ambiance as the day dances on the edge of autumn.

As evening approaches, the clouds will part slightly, giving way to the soft embrace of partly cloudy skies and cooler temperatures. Those stepping out might find it wise to don a light jacket, perhaps a sweater beneath, shielding against the briskness of the southwest wind, while gaining comfort in layers. As twilight nears, consider a comforting retreat—perhaps cozying up with a warm drink at a local café, or simply enjoying a quiet walk along the water, where the sound of distant waves whispers secrets of the changing seasons. The day may not shine brightly, but there is beauty in the intimacy of a fog-drenched afternoon, inviting moments of reflection amid the gentle chaos of life.
